Hi all

I am a second year student at the Indian Institute of Technology,
K=
anpur, and am currently working under a summer undergraduate research
progr=
am. My project is to explore various neuro-evolution approaches
to time ser=
ies prediction.

I am trying to code my own version of NEAT for the same. I=
 am trying
to model it on Matlab_neat by Christian Mayr. 

One thing that I=
 observed in the implementation of matlab neat is that
the search for innov=
ations is always limited to the particular
generation in which we are tryin=
g to bring about the mutation. Is
there any particular reason for wanting t=
o do so? Is this done only in
Matlab neat or is it a part of the NEAT proce=
ss itself?

thanks,
regards
Sidhant
